bibl.title: List: The Yellow Fever Roll of Honor, [n.d.]

div1.p: The Office of the Surgeon General lists the individuals on the yellow fever roll of honor. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: List: The Yellow Fever Roll of Honor, [n.d.]
div1.p: THE YELLOW FEVER ROLL OF HONOR.

row.cell: Died of yellow fever, not experimental
Pvt. Andrus, John H. - H.C. Sick 28 Jan. 1901
Pvt. Dean, Wm. H., Troop B, 7 Cav. died May 3 1928 - Sick 7 Sept. 1900
Pvt. Hamann, P. 23 Bat. C.A.C. _ _ _ _ _ _ 19 Oct "

Pvt. Hildebrand, James - H.C.
(Volunteered for mosquito, but too old)

Pvt. Weatherwalks, Edward, - H.C.
(He declined mosquito test)

div1.p: THE YELLOW FEVER ROLL OF HONOR.

row.cell: Major James Carroll * Had experimental yellow fever
Dr. Jesse W. Lazear * Died of yellow fever, not experimental
Pvt. Dean, Wm. H., Troop B, 7 Cav.
Pvt. Folk, Levi E. H.C. Y.F. & fomites
Pvt. Hanberry, Jas. F., H.C. Y.F. & fomites deserted
Pvt. Jernegan, Warren G., H.C. Y.F. & fomites

Pvt. Hildebrand, James, H.C.
(Volunteered for mosquito, but too old)

Pvt. Weatherwalks, Edward, H.C.
(He declined mosqito test)

Miss Clara Louise Maass - inoculated by mosquitoes
Aug. 14 - died of yellow fever Aug 24, 1901.

div1.p:
Note - In addition to the above 7 Spaniards suffered ex-
perimental yellow fever in the Reed Board experiments with
no deaths, and 6 in the Gorgas- Guiterias experiments
with two deaths.

War Department
Office of the Surgeon General
Washington, D. C.
THE YELLOW FEVER ROLL OF HONOR

The Yellow Fever Board.
1. Major Walter Reed, Chairman. Died of Appendicitis Nov. 23, 1902.
2. Major James Carroll. Had experimental yellow fever. Recovered,
but died of heart disease Sept. 16 1907.
3. Dr. Jesse W. Lazear. Died Sept. 25, 1900 of yellow fever, not
experimental, in Camp Columbia, Cuba.
4. Dr. Aristides Agramonte. Now professor in the Medical School of
the University of Havana.

Persons subjected to yellow fever experiments.
1. Private John H. Andrus, Hospital Corps.
2. Mr. John R. Bullard. Civilian. Graduate of Harvard.
3. Private A. W. Covington. 23 Battalion, C.A.C.
4. Private William H. Dean. Troop B, 7 Cavalry.
5. Private Wallace Forbes. Hospital Corps.
6. Private Levi E. Folk. Hospital Corps. Yellow fever and fomites.
7. Private P. Hamann. 23 Battalion, C.A.C.
8. Private James F. Hanberry. Hospital Corps. Yellow fever and
fomites.
9. Private Warren G. Jernegan. Hospital Corps. Yellow fever and
fomites.
10. Private John R. Kissinger. Hospital Corps.
11. Mr. John J. Moran. Civilian Clerk.
12. Private William Olson. Hospital Corps.
13. Private Charles G. Sontag. Hospital Corps.
14. Private Clyde L. West. Hospital Corps.

Exposed to fomites only.
1. Dr. R. P. Cooke.
2. Private Thomas M. England. Hospital Corps.
3. Private James Hildebrand. Hospital Corps.
4. Private Edward Weatherwalks. Hospital Corps.

Guiteras Experiments at Las Animas Hospital (to determine possible
immunity as a result of a mild experimental attack of yellow fever.)
1. John R. Taylor. Clerk at Las Animas Hospital.
2. Clara Louise Maass. Inoculated by mosquitoes, August 14, 1901,
died of yellow fever, August 24, 1901.

Note. -- In addition to the above, seven Spaniards suffered experimental
yellow fever in the Reed Board experiments with no deaths, and
six in the Guiteras experiments with two deaths.
